org.divxdede.swing.busy.icon
Class InfiniteBusyIcon

java.lang.Object
  java.util.Observable
      org.divxdede.swing.busy.icon.AbstractBusyIcon
          org.divxdede.swing.busy.icon.InfiniteBusyIcon
All Implemented Interfaces:
javax.swing.Icon, BusyIcon
public class InfiniteBusyIcon
extends AbstractBusyIcon

An infinite icon rendering always an undeterminate state as long as the model is busy (whenever the model's state).

This implementation use a BusyPainter from the swingx library.
But this icon can be used as a simple icon without constraint to be embedded into a JXBusyLabel in order to be animated.
You can set the frame rate using the method setDelay(int) that give the delay in milliseconds between 2 frames.

Since:
1.1
Author:
André Sébastien (divxdede)

isDeterminate

public boolean isDeterminate()
This icon don't support a determinate state. It's why this method return always false.

getSignificantRatioOffset

protected float getSignificantRatioOffset()
Since this icon render only undeterminate state, this method has no really interrest. we return arbitrary 0.01f (1%) offset

Specified by:
getSignificantRatioOffset in class AbstractBusyIcon
Returns:
Minimum ratio offset that must be reach by the BoundedRangeModel between to paint processes. Can be set to 0 for serve all paint's requests
See Also:
AbstractBusyIcon.useCache(), AbstractBusyIcon.setUseCache(boolean), AbstractBusyIcon.getRatio()
